answer_to_complaint.description: Answer must be served within 21 days after service of summons and complaint (FRCP § 12(a)(1)(A)(i))
exceptions: Extended to 60 days for U.S. government defendants
Extended to 90 days for foreign government defendants
Waiver of service extends to 60 days from waiver request

motion_to_dismiss.description: Motion to Dismiss must be filed before answer, typically within 21 days of service (FRCP § 12(b))
exceptions: Extension by stipulation (up to 21 days) or court order

interrogatories.description: Response to interrogatories must be served within 30 days (FRCP § 33(b)(2))

requests_for_admission.description: Response to requests for admission must be served within 30 days (FRCP § 36(a)(3))

deposition_notice.description: Reasonable notice must be given for deposition (typically 14 days minimum)

initial_disclosure.description: Initial disclosures due within 14 days after Rule 26(f) conference (FRCP § 26(a)(1)(C))

motion_filing.description: Written motion and notice of hearing must be served at least 14 days before hearing (FRCP § 6(c)(1))
exceptions: Extended by 3 days if served by mail
Extended by 3 days if served electronically
Local rules may specify different periods

appeal_deadline.description: Notice of Appeal must be filed within 30 days after entry of judgment (FRAP § 4(a)(1)(A))
exceptions: Extended to 60 days if U.S. government is a party
Extension of up to 30 days may be granted for excusable neglect

notice_period.description: Ex parte TRO may be issued without notice if specific showing is made (FRCP § 65(b)(1))

filing_time.description: Ex parte applications heard at discretion of assigned judge

requirements: Verified complaint or affidavit showing immediate irreparable injury
Certificate of counsel detailing efforts to notify or reasons why notice should not be required
Security bond as required by FRCP § 65(c)
Court order after showing personal service impracticable
Service as directed by court order
May include mail, email, or publication

service_by_mail.description: Service by mail adds 3 days to response period (FRCP § 6(d))

electronic_service.description: Electronic service adds 3 days to response period (FRCP § 6(d))

court_fees.fee_waiver_form: Application to Proceed In Forma Pauperis (AO 240)
